snippet: In the first move toward an expected wave of consolidations, eight large United Ways in California agreed yesterday to merge back-office operations this year and, later, to coordinate their marketing.    The United Ways in Los Angeles, the San Fra...
lead_paragraph: In the first move toward an expected wave of consolidations, eight large United Ways in California agreed yesterday to merge back-office operations this year and, later, to coordinate their marketing. The United Ways in Los Angeles, the San Francisco Bay Area and Fresno are making the move to cut costs, said Robert Martin, chief financial officer for United Way of the Bay Area. Donations have fallen since 1992, after the president of United Way of America went to prison for stealing from the charity.
abstract: Eight large United Ways in California will merge back-office operations and coordinate marketing (S)
